ai.summary: A short, easy 1.3 km hike in the UK. The route (Crowan BR 142) offers a gentle walk suitable for beginners and families, with minimal elevation and well-marked paths.
ai.terrain_summary: Gentle, well-defined paths with easy footing. Typically flat with occasional uneven sections; conditions may vary with weather, so be prepared for mud or damp ground.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly. Wear sturdy footwear, bring a waterproof layer, and carry water. Stay on marked paths, mind other walkers, and plan for shorter daylight hours in winter. If traveling with children or mobility concerns, assess suitability in advance.
recommended_gear: Light rain jacket or waterproof shell
Map, GPS device, or fully charged phone
Small first aid kit (blister care, basic supplies)
ai.best_seasons: All year, with the most comfortable conditions in late spring to early autumn. Be prepared for cooler, wetter weather outside of the summer months.
